[16:42] Sovietscare: like a portrait of your family?

we received a call from sarah (beth's sister) over the weekend to tell us that beth had passed away. it's difficult to imagine what sort of mindset she must have been in this past year, but i suppose she was never truly happy with her life.
it's unfortunate that things worked out like this, and if anything could have been done to change her mind i know that jamie and i would have done it.
sometimes people just have it out for themselves and there's no way to change their mind about things. 
beth didn't have to be "like her mother" she could have been anything that she liked.
it would have been difficult, but i really believe that she could have made it out without this happening. i wish that her children could have grown up and known her personally instead of the second-hand version that they will get from their father and grandparents.
beth had her faults just like anyone else. She was, however, someone who selflessly cared for other people and never enough about herself.
my first reaction was anger, as it was earlier in the year when a similar incident occurred.
i want to be angry with her for leaving her children, hurting jamie and not having the courage to continue on.
i can't be upset with her though.
she'd had a difficult life, and had many reasons to be tired of it, i'm sure many more than anyone close to her is even aware of.
she was a really good friend to jamie for a long time and i'm thankful to her for that.
i still remember eating breakfast with her years ago, before our duel wayne court dates.
we sat up at rex's and talked for a couple hours. she was always such an honest person, caring and open about everything. she seemed full of life even though she'd surely been beaten down by it. she had a wonderful smile and displayed it constantly. i could conjure many compliments about her, sadly i don't think i ever told her any of them.
the majority of my contact was with a beth that had just recently undergone a divorce, the loss of her mother and felt that her life was pointless.
maybe she thought that when this happened, when she moved away and stopped talking to people, that no one would miss her or ever think about her again.
i'll remember you forever and i know jamie will as well.
i hope that you're somewhere where you can be ok with you.
you should be somewhere that you can be happy.
we both love you and we'll miss you a bunch.

Ten Top Trivia Tips about Ryan Romans!

  1. The water in oceans is four times less salty than the water in Ryan Romans!
  2. Ryan Romans will often glow under UV light.
  3. Ryan Romans has only one weakness - the colour yellow!
  4. Ninety-six percent of all candles sold are purchased by Ryan Romans.
  5. Ryan Romans can use only about ten percent of his brain!
  6. Only one person in two billion will live to be Ryan Romans!
  7. About one tenth of Ryan Romans is permanently covered in ice.
  8. People used to believe that dressing their male children as Ryan Romans would protect them from evil spirits!
  9. Edinburgh imports three thousand kilograms of Ryan Romans every year!
  10. There are six towns named Ryan Romans in the United States.
I am interested in - do tell me about

Ryan --
[noun]:

A hermit living in the big city

✓ I have changed a diaper before. × I've called the cops on a friend before. × I'm not allergic to anything.
× I have a lot to learn. × I am shy around the opposite sex. × I'm online 24/7, even as an away message.

× I would die for my best friends. ✓ I'm obsessive, and often a perfectionist. × I have used my sexuality to advance my career.
✓ I think Halloween is awesome because you get free candy. × I have dated a close friend's ex. ✓ I am happy at this moment.
× I'm obsessed with guys. × Democrat. × Republican.
× I don't even know what I am. × I am punk rockish. × I go for older guys/girls, not younger.
× I study for tests most of the time. × I tie my shoelaces differently from anyone I've ever met. ✓ I can work on a car.
✓ I love my job(s). ✓ I am comfortable with who I am right now. × I have more than just my ears pierced.

× I hate office jobs. × I went to college out of state. × I am adopted.

× I fall for the worst people. ✓ I adore bright colours. × I usually like covers better than originals.

× I've often thought that I was born in the wrong century. × I try to forget things by drowning them out with loads of distractions. × I wear a toe ring.
✓ I have a tattoo. × I can't stand at LEAST one person that I work with. × I am a caffeine junkie.
× I am completely tree-huggy spiritual, and I'm not ashamed at all. × If I knew I would get away with it, I would commit at least one murder. × I will collect anything, and the more nonsensical, the better.
× I enjoy a nice glass of wine with dinner. ✓ I'm an artist. × I am ambidextrous.
× I sleep with so many stuffed animals, I can hardly fit on my bed. × If it weren't for having to see other people naked, I'd live in a nudist colony. × I have terrible teeth.

× I like the way women look in stylized men's suits. × I don't like it when people are unpleased or seem unpleased with me. × I have been described as a dreamer or likely to have my head up in the clouds.
× I have played strip poker with someone else before. × I have had emotional problems for which I have sought professional help. ✓ I believe in ghosts and the paranormal.
× I can't stand being alone. ✓ I have at least one obsession at any given time. × I weigh myself, pee/poo, and then weigh myself again.
× I consistently spend way too much money on obsessions-of-the-moment. ✓ I'm a judgmental asshole. × I'm a HUGE drama-queen.

✓ I am obsessed with history/historical things and can't wait for someone to build a time machine so I can be the first to use it. × I can never remember for the life of me where I parked the car. ✓ I had the TEEN ANGST thing going for at least 2-3 years.
✓ I wish people would be more empathic and honest with each other. × I play Dungeons and Dragons weekly. × I love to sing.
× I want to live in my mother's basement when I grow up. × I have a custom-built computer. × I want to create a certain someone's babies, even though there's a 0% possiblity of ever achieving it.

× I wish there were a way to erase past mistakes. × I sleep more than 12 hours a day. ✓ I wish I could be prouder of what I've accomplished, but it's never enough.

× I download songs from the internet. × I've just reenacted chapter 58 of Death Note with my best friend. × I say random things to freak people out.
× I'm still a little mad about the ending of Death Note. × I love playing Truth or Dare. × I love listening to slow music, but I hate singing to it.
× Music helps me remember that I am not alone. × Playing my favorite sport makes me temporarily forget my problems. × I think this survey is particularly long.

keeping it together today alright.
i walked into work today and was quickly made privy to the fact that the pt cruiser shot i have been working on for the last 12 hours had almost completely changed in visual style. what this means to me is that all of the lighting needs to be completely re-worked and any previous passes that have already rendered out need to be dumped and re-done.
the scene also had to be re-sized and rendered within 20 minutes due to the fact that the interiors were being photographed and the manic photographer on the phone only had access to the studio for a very short window today.

i think that all of this junk is done now?

everything is going great at home. jamie is apparently something like the master of gravy at ikea and is doing very well there. i wish that i could be home more and not working so often. i guess i understand the reasons that i work such long hours *sniff*, just wish i didn't have to all the time is all.

over the weekend i had the pleasure of attending the wayne chamber of commerce garage sale, which is held in a four story parking structure. which pleased me muchly.
i purchased two red blown glass birds, a set of ceramic oranges (which are salt and pepper shakers), a ceramic lumberjack mug, a large framed picture with elevation schematics of the golden gate bridge, and a 1950's paint by numbers forest (in oranges, browns, and greens) framed. 

i remain satisfied with my purchases to this day.

The first ten people to comment on this post get to request a doodle/sketch/drabble from me on a subject/character of their choosing.

In return, they have to post this meme in their journal. (Actually, I'm not going to deny you free goodies if you don't, but sharing is good, yes? Spread the love!)

This is a meme I approve of because it involves sharing and creativity!

[ETA: Remember to tell me what you want!]

just outside the studio door is a field of tall grass.
as evening approaches, (as well as early morning) the wind blows through the field, moving the grass with it. 
the wind is warm and bird songs can be heard chiming out from trees in the field.
in the field lives a groundhog mother (formerly known as scott) and her four small groundhog children. 
at dusk tonight i observed them.
they nibble on the fresh grass as the sky is painted pink, blue and magenta.

the groundhog, also known as the whistlepig.

today it roasts outside.
i'm still at work, rendering for volkswagen, wishing that i was home.
i really enjoy what i do, and having a bunch of beer to drink at work is pretty nifty too, but i wish that i could just call it a day today.
i suppose that i kind of voluntarily entered a career that requires long hours and saint-like devotion.

you know the type loud as a motor bike,
but wouldn't bust a grape in a fruit fight

started my new job a couple of weeks ago.
i really feel like every aspect of working here is an improvement over rocket studios.
we've been working on the teaser trailer for the new transformers movie over the past couple weeks and i'm pretty excited about seeing something that i worked on up on a movie screen even if it's just a trailer.
i watched the LOST finale on wednesday, actually i kind of planned my day around watching it (yeah, judge me.) a little confused about the four-toed statue deal but realy excited for next season. i'll be doing some dorky update on my LOST blog (blogspot user: lockeandkey) later this week i suppose. 
yeah, not too much has been happening lately, we're settling into the house. we discovered recently however that our bedroom and the upstairs in general holds hellish heat when it gets warm out manifesting the need for rubber sheets (?) due to profuse sweating during sleeping hours. but yeah, we didn't actually get rubber sheets, eww.
apparently i've forgotten how to update a livejournal entry and will now desist.

only a couple days until jamie gets to work the mega-ikea opening.

the wedding was beautiful and jamie looked breath~taking.
i will be posting some pictures up soon.
i picked up some flowers from the flower shop i used to hang out at.
a girl who works there now lectured me for about 45 minutes on how after getting married i would feel completely different about jamie. she said that i would love jamie so much more and that we would become so much closer after the wedding. i think i've always felt close to jamie. and i think that i love her more every day. it's definitely not something that is effected by my marital status.

the real challenge begins tomorrow.
i have to finish scraping off all of the wicked wallpaper from our upstairs walls. the floors have been finished and all that remains is to paint and fix the plumbing before we move in. i'm so anxious to move in. owning a house but not being able to occupy is beyond frustrating. 
oh yeah, i also have to build all of the ikea furniture, but that's the fun part.

p.s. my music selection of the day came courtesy in my bass ale box.
kind of like cereal prizes for adults.

getting married tomorrow!
not really getting nervous, just really curious as to how everything is going to turn out with the families meeting each other, pretty much for the first time.
well, anyways, i'm just really excited!

this is the randomness that periodically appears in my mind, no doubt this is due to countless hours of video game playing over the years.

"Try to have at least one hundered hearts before you come here. Look around
town and buy some Garlic and some Laurels. Go one screen right and drop some
Garlic on the ground. A guy will appear, talk to him and you'll get a Silver
Knife. Go back to town and talk to the man in grey at the top of the town,
he'll trade your White Crystal for a Blue Crystal. Go two screens to the
left and go down the stairs. Go to the edge of the lake, select the Blue
Crystal and crouch. After a few seconds. the screen will scroll up a little
bit and it will be safe to enter the lake. Now you're at Rover Mansion"

as a side note, i would never trade anyone a silver knife for a piece of garlic.
just messing around at work, learning a new 3d program. made this and thought it was pretty neat-o.

Herzog Shot During Interview 
By WENN|Friday, February 03, 2006
HOLLYWOOD - German director Werner Herzog was shot by a crazed fan during a recent interview with the BBC.
 The 63-year-old was chatting with movie journalist Mark Kermode about his documentary Grizzly Man, when a sniper opened fire with an air rifle. 

Kermode explains, "I thought a firecracker had gone off. 

"Herzog, as if it was the most normal thing in the world, said, 'Oh, someone is shooting at us. We must go.' 

"He had a bruise the size of a snooker ball, with a hole in. He just carried on with the interview while bleeding quietly in his boxer shorts." 

An unrepentant Herzog insisted, "It was not a significant bullet. I am not afraid." 


*alice posted this up, i think it re-enforces my admiration and interest in this man.

so guess what...
jamie and i went out to eat at benihanna.
about five minutes after we sit down who should walk and be seated at the table directly next to us?
that's right! aaron neville!
regardless to say, we were both very excited!
i've never seen him perform, and in fact easily confuse his voice with luther vandross, but was very impressed with his massive hulk-like physique and cool-ass prison face tattoo!
it was amazing!
i bought a house for jamie, eddie and I to live in. it's really pretty!

when i left for work, the air outside was very still and frigid.
i'm always impressed by winter and how still and pure everything can seem outside while the temperature is very low. although i miss the colors of summer and spring, i certainly do not miss the smells and humidity. i was sad to see fall go so quickly, as it is my favorite blend of both, and during this season the world seems to contain a bit more depth and beauty.

i started my car and spent a little while clearing the snow and ice that had accumulated on jamie's windshield.
usually on the way to work i listen to howard stern. i've been doing this for as long as i've had any sort of morning employment. on thursday however, it is his last "free" radio performance as he will be moving to SIRIUS.
i'm not exactly sure what i'll listen to now on the drive to work. listening to people talk is preferable to listening to music in the morning as it doesn't really put me in any certain type of mood.
a neutral kind of mood is preferable as i am waking up and heading into work.

the 18th is my 26th birthday and for the first time i am feeling old.
26 seems to be a good age for feeling this way though.
i don't feel old in a negative sense though, my life is really just beginning to shape into something resembling what i've hoped for. i think primarily that i am very satisfied with my life.
although i wish that i could have changed certain aspects of my life and made better decisions, i accept that these changes would have effected my present existence negatively.
thankfully, i've made the decisions that led me to this point and current happiness.

this evening i plan on stopping by the library to pick up two books for jamie and look around a little for myself. i've decided not to invest too much time is searching for something that interests me though. i have books at home that i haven't even opened yet, let alone read.
my other duty tonight is preparing salmon patties for dinner, as it is jamie's late day at school tonight.
i think somewhere in-between i'll sneak in some time in animal crossingDS.

with the completion of the sport trac catalog artwork, 
activity around the studio has been null.
i don't have too much to finish up today and thinking about leaving a little earlier than usual (usual is around 7-7:30 though recently.)
i've been reading discussions on "tabula rasa" for about an hour
while i slowly clean up an old model.

i just recieved the sweetest letter ever:

                    Hey Rye-
                            I need you to call me
                            it is in regards to dinner
                            i was just thinking about the time when we were walking in
                            frankenmuth down the slippery incline and i was wearing my 
                            boots and you kept me from falling
                                                      <3
                                                      jamie

i can't wait until i get to spend the evening with her.

My LiveJournal Sitcom
Being reproduction (FOXFAM, 10:30): reproduction (Dennis Miller) plays chess against lackluster (Claire Forlani), who doesn't know how. Nearby, poasiapersuasia (Richard Dean Anderson) gets mad at ewanioangal2511 (Haley Joel Osment) and decides to join the Peace Corps. The week after, stoprockroll (Michael Moore) and breakingeraduce (Sigourney Weaver) buy the junkyard. Later, pinback_attack (Horatio Sanz) overhears duck1123 (Jonathan Rhys Meyers) talking about Lovecraftian horror. (Part 2 of 2.)
What's Your LiveJournal Sitcom? (by rfreebern)

this morning was beautiful and quiet.
the snow started falling at around nine-thirty, although i hadn't noticed it until around 11:00.
i've been working fervently on the sport trac catalog, i wish i could post some images but they're "hush-hush."
i'm listening to ziggy stardust this morning 
and hoping that no one can hear me humming along.
i was really surprised by a white german shepard (one of the art director's dogs) this morning as he flew around the corner near the kitchen.
i decided to reward him with some jalapeno cheese.
